content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Block Count & Layers
The target structure consists of 7 building blocks arranged in approximately 3 layers:
- Bottom layer: Green rectangular block and orange cylinder
- Middle layer: Blue cube, yellow cube, and orange triangular block
- Top layer: Red U-shaped block resting on the orange cylinder

## Spatial Relationships
- The green rectangular block (horizontal orientation) serves as part of the base
- An orange cylinder stands vertically at the right side of the structure
- A blue cube sits on the left side of the green block
- A yellow cube is positioned next to the blue cube
- An orange triangular block is placed near the green base
- A red U-shaped block sits atop the orange cylinder

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the target image, I need the following blocks:
1. Block #3 - Red U-shaped block (with the U facing upward)
2. Block #6 - Blue cube
3. Block #7 - Yellow cube
4. Block #8 - Green rectangular block (horizontal orientation)
5. Block #13 - Orange cylinder
6. Block #15 - Orange triangular block

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 8
   Step2: Move block with index 13
   Step3: Move block with index 15
   Step4: Move block with index 6
   Step5: Move block with index 7
   Step6: Move block with index 3
}
```

The assembly follows a bottom-up approach, starting with the base (green rectangular block), then placing the main supporting cylinder, adding the triangular block and cubes in the middle layer, and finally placing the red U-shaped block on top of the cylinder.
